member.name: M:DidiSoft.Pgp.KeyStore.SignPublicKey(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Signs a public key with a private key.
member.remarks:
Signing a key certifies that you know the owner of the keys.
When you import keys into your and are sure that the trusted third party is really the organization/person they claim to be, you can sign his/her keys.
PGP command line(r) equivalent:
pgp --sign-key keyUserId --signer signingKeyUserId --sig-type exportable
GnuPG equivalent command:
gpg --local-user signingKeyUserId --sign-key keyUserId
member.param: User Id of the public key to be signed
User Id of the own private key to be used for signing
Password of the own private key
member.exception: No private key has been found with such Key Id
No public key has been found with such Key Id
OpenPGP signing error

member.summary: Signs a public key with a private key.
member.remarks:
Signing a key certifies that you know the owner of the keys.
When you import keys into your and are sure that the trusted third party is really the organization/person they claim to be, you can sign his/her keys.
PGP command line(r) equivalent:
pgp --sign-key keyUserId --signer signingKeyUserId
GnuPG equivalent command:
gpg --local-user signingKeyUserId --sign-key keyUserId
member.param: User Id of the public key to be signed
User Id of the own private key to be used for signing
Password of the own private key
if true then the signature is exportable, otherwise it is a local signature
member.exception: No private key has been found with such Key Id
No public key has been found with such Key Id
OpenPGP signing error

member.name: M:DidiSoft.Pgp.KeyStore.DeletePrivateKey(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the first private key from this key store that has the specified User Id.
member.remarks:
If more than one key exist with the supplied User Id, only the first one is affected.
If no key exists with the specified User Id, no changes to the key store occurs.
This method is equivalent to the GnuPG commands:
gpg --delete-secret-keys [userId]
member.param: User Id or hexadecimal Key ID of the private key to be deleted
member.returns: if the key is deleted, if there is no key with the specified User Id

example.code:
Imports System Imports DidiSoft.Pgp
Public Class DeletePrivateKey Public Shared Sub Demo() Dim ks As New KeyStore("pgp.keystore", "changeit") ks.DeletePrivateKey("test@gmail.com") End Sub End Class

member.name: M:DidiSoft.Pgp.KeyStore.GenerateEccKeyPair(DidiSoft.Pgp.EcCurve,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an Elliptic Curve OpenPGP key pair with default values for preferred compression, hashing and cypher
member.remarks:
Preferred hash algorithms are: SHA-256, SHA-384, SHA-512, SHA-224
Preferred cipher algorithms are: AES-256, AES-192, AES-128
Preferred compression algorithms are: ZIP, BZIP2, ZLIB, UNCOMPRESSED
member.param: Elliptic Curve used in the key generation
User Id of the form "name (comment) <email address>"
Secret key password

ks.GenerateEccKeyPair(curve, userId, privateKeyPassword) End Sub End Class

pgp --sign-key keyId --signer signingKeyId --sig-type exportable

Imports System Imports System.IO Imports DidiSoft.Pgp
Public Class DecryptAndVerifyStream Public Sub Demo() ' create an instance of the library Dim pgp As New PGPLib()
' OpenPGP signed and encrypted data Using dataStream As Stream = File.OpenRead("DataFiles\OUTPUTse.pgp"), _ senderPublicKeyStream As Stream = File.OpenRead("DataFiles\sender_public_key.asc"), _ privateKeyStream As Stream = File.OpenRead("DataFiles\my_private_key.asc")

' private key to be used for decryption Dim privateKeyPassword As String = "private key password"

example.code:
Imports System Imports DidiSoft.Pgp
Class KeyStoreSignString Public Sub Demo() Dim signingKeyUserId As String = "support@didisoft.com" Dim signingKeyPassword As String = "private key password"
' initialize the key store Dim ks As New KeyStore("DataFiles\key.store", "key store password")
' if this key store contains a key with the desired recipient userId - encrypt, ' otherwise notify that there is no such key If ks.ContainsKey(signingKeyUserId) Then Dim pgp As New PGPLib()
Dim plainText As String = "Hello World"
Dim signedString As String = pgp.SignString(plainText, ks, signingKeyUserId, signingKeyPassword) Else Console.WriteLine("No key with user Id:" + signingKeyUserId + " was found in this key store.") End If End Sub End Class

member.exception: if a signing error has occurred
if the supplied password for the private key is incorrect
if there is no private key in this with such User Id
